lines.text:
[Loudly]
Say, where can I get an illustrated copy of "Aphrodite?"
Young man, you're evidently unaware that that book is not in circulation.
Take ya out to dinner tonight, Allie.
Well, thanks Daisy. I'd love to have dinner with you. We'll go Dutch.
Uh, uh. The boyfriend's entertaining, and he's got a guy that's crazy to meet you, Allie.
A blind date? No thanks!
Oh, this guy Pete's got ain't blind. Gee Allie, he'd go for ya in a big way!
Well, I don't want to be gone for.

[whining]
Awww gosh. Aw gee, Allie, don't be a wet smack all your life.
I'm not a wet smack, Daisy, I'm just particular who I go out with.
How about giving Rudy Vallee a buzz?
Ya think he'd buzz back?
I hope you're a good dancer.
Say, dancin's my business.
Ever mix business with pleasure?
What's your idea of pleasure?
What's yours?

[Doing a little shimmy in place]
Boop-boop-a-doop!
[last lines]
Gee, Allie you're the swellest dame in this whole cockeyed world.
Go wash your face. It's a sight.

[First lines]
Hi, Sugar.
Hello.
Is it okay for tonight? Did you get a tomater for Charlie?
He wants some new talent. Hey, how 'bout that girl that works here?
You mean Allie Smith?
Yeah, she looks hot!
Yeah, hot like a Frigidaire.
Well, maybe he could raise her temperature. Go on, get her!

[Looking at a Chinese menu]
Well, I don't know what this all means - but, it looks exciting. Now, what's that?
That's bird's nest zuop!
What kinda bird?
Cuckoo.
I don't know what it is about a mug like Charlie Riggs. Every time you dames lay eyes on him, you start going crazy.

[to a Chinese waiter]
Chow mein, Fu Man Chu and make it fast!
I see you got that tie on again. Won't you never learn not to wear red after six o'clock?
Sure is swell to come up after a hard day's work at the office and find a couple of swell-lookin' gals waitin' for ya.
Say, you ought to be in the movies with that face.
Sure, I'd make a swell target for custard pies.
I thought you were selling real estate up in Westchester?
Not selling, slug, buying!
Buying, what?
Land! To build a movie studio on.
Say, you'd go swell in pictures, Miss Smith. Your eyes - they got soul in 'em. No kiddin'. I'm tellin' ya! With your looks, you'd be a real find.
It won't be long now. You go ahead and finesse your Queen. We're gonna make this rubber.
Ya, let's dance.

[to Miss Smith]
Don't let him sell ya anything you woudn't take home to your mother.
The last time I handed anybody a line was on a moonlite night in Calcutta.
Oh, have you been to Calcutta?
Sure, I've been all over. Calcutta. Rangoon. Mandalay.
Only once did I see blue like you got in your eyes and that was on the China sea, one morning, after a typhoon.
It must be wonderful to go to all of those places. I've often dreamed about them.
Yeah. Well, I'm gonna do some dreamin' myself tonight, but, it's not going to be about geography.
[Runs his finger down the collar of Allie's jacket]

[Sarcastically]
Swell fixer you turned out to be!
I should get tomaters for you!
Hey, Adonis, come on, will ya. Hurry up. We got places to go.
Yeah, come on! Shake a leg!
Alright. Alright! Keep your shirt on!
Sometimes I do get lonely, but, not for people. I get lonely - for thinking of places I've never been to. You know, far away places. Rangoon. Mandalay. Have you ever felt that way?
Yes, in deed.
And, maybe - maybe somebody to be there with you. Somebody you can be proud of and look up to. You don't know who? I guess all girls are that way when they're my age. Just crazy-headed!
Boy, I just gotta peak at somethin' new in the dressing room and is she a hot tomata! Mmmm!
Say, you don't have to tell me how to handle these babies, honey. I've worked at every taxi dance joint between here and 14th Street.
This sheik you're tellin' me about, what's his name? Riggs?
Good time Charlie, in person! Play 'em easy kid, he knows all the answers.
Why should I waste my liquor on you? Are you a good lookin' dame?
Well, no, but I can fix one up for ya.
Hey, sit down and have a snort.
Sure, why not?
Do you wanna dance?
Sure, I guess so.
Well, don't break your ankle gettin' up.
Wisecracker, heh?
No, just a little girl tryin' to get along.
Do you wanna bump hits with me or would you rather pull taffy?
Whaddaya mean you could go for me in a big way?
You look like a million bucks.
And just as hard to get.

[Dancing cheek-to-cheek]
Oh, mamie!
Daddy!
Whaddaya doin' tonight?
Got any ideas?
Plenty.
I wish - I don't know what I wish.
Well, I'm a monkey's grandpa!
I ain't had a break since I married you. Everything I tackle seems to go floppo!

[Throwing dice]
Eighter! Eighter from Decater! Watch me get 'em now. Hummph! Well, I'm gettin' close. I got my red flannel underwear on and I'm certainly warm. Hummph!
[Disappointed]
It sure did snow someplace.
That's no reason for standing me up! You could give a lonely girl a ring once in awhile.
My bad luck streak is broke. From now on can watch my tail lights!
Well, spank me naked!
Say, when does this razzle start?
Getta look at the female gigolo!
Oh, why don't you get wise to yourself. Good time Charlie. You've been foolin' nobody but yourself. What a sap to be runnin' around loose. Why don't you go home to that dumb cluck you married!
You'll keep my wife's name out of your dirty mouth!
Oh, she's nothin' but a -
[gets slapped]
